an4.158:2.1: “Reverends, any monk or nun who sees four things inside themselves should conclude:
an4.158:2.3: For this is what the Buddha calls decline.’
an4.158:2.5: They have much greed, much hate, and much delusion; and their wisdom eye doesn’t go into the many deep matters.
an4.158:2.6: Any monk or nun who sees these four things inside themselves should conclude:
an4.158:2.8: For this is what the Buddha calls decline.’
an4.158:3.1: Any monk or nun who sees four things inside themselves should conclude:
an4.158:3.3: For this is what the Buddha calls non-decline.’
an4.158:3.5: Their greed, hate, and delusion grow less; and their wisdom eye goes into the many deep matters.
an4.158:3.6: Any monk or nun who sees these four things inside themselves should conclude:
an4.158:3.8: For this is what the Buddha calls non-decline.’”
